page.title: 01New Galloway
page.content: Originally a Royal Borough, New Galloway is a relatively small village in the beautifully picturesque Glenkens area. It consists of closely knit, colour washed houses astride the main street. There are 2 small housing estates and about 30 detached dwellings on the outskirts of the village. A small group of houses extend along the line of the old Edinburgh Road which used to run through the settlement. The meeting of the 2 roads, old and new, is marked by the imposing Town Hall which forms one of the corners of the junction. The street pattern and the Scottish vernacular architecture of the village makes it worthy of conservation.There is a Church, School and basic shopping facilities. Due mainly to an influx of English people, the population has increased to, approximately, 370.
